content.description: Start in the lower right hand corner of the main wall; easier if you start on Devil's Classic. Move diagonally left through to the top of the corner, finish just before reaching the corner. Another near classic, limited by the inability to lead it.
content.location: Starts lower right, diagonal to the top of Cheater's Corner.

content.description: Start just to the left of "Cheaters Crack" and climb the mossy face. DO NOT USE THE ARETE!!!! The route is mostly clean but it is still pretty dirty at the top. The crux is about halfway up where there is a blank slate of rock. Go up left to a bad side pull / crimp. Get a high left foot and go into high the gaston with your right hand. Cross with your left hand to the jug. The crux sequence might prove to be difficult for shorter climbers. Continue and top out.
content.protection: Anchor to the small trees at the top.

content.description: This would get 4 stars if it were longer and leadable. Start 3' right of the Cheaters corner, without using the large block for feet. Move up and tending right, ending on the top of Devil's Classic b. The bottom is the crux, tricky hands.
Start on the large white jug, as on Devil's Classic, instead of traversing left, head straight up. Harder for those <5'10".
Start on large white jug, move up to where your feet are on the jug, then work left and up. For those vertically challenged the crux is getting started.
The farthest left line on the wall, a crack ascends the corner.
content.location: The far left corner. Many options to make it easier or harder.

content.description: To the right and around the corner from the classic's, (you passed it on the walk down). Climb the left side of the wall without using the wall behind you or the arete. It gets harder the further right you move. Full of dirty, sloping, slick, basalt edges...in other words, fun!
content.location: Around the corner from the classics.

content.description: The name comes from a very unfortunate event that happened while taking a break from cleaning this route. The climb is just to the left of the arete on the wall closest to the Yahi trail. There are a few loose rocks so make sure your belayer stands back from the wall and/or wears a helmet.
content.protection: Top rope anchors are trees, sign post, or the boulder. Bring long slings or a static rope.
content.location: Walk 15 feet up the Yahi trail from the main Devil's Kitchen wall to find the top rope anchors. Route ascends the wall directly downhill from the holly-leaved redberry sign.
